info.name: Bandwidth API Collection
info.description: This is the Bandwidth Collection.  It contains an API reference and tutorials for the basic functionality of the Voice, Messaging, Numbers, and Account APIs.

item.name: Messaging Tutorials

request.description: Sends a text message
Sends a group text message
Sends a MMS message with a media attachment
Sends a group MMS message with a media attachment

item.description: This is the Bandwidth Messaging tutorials. In order to use these endpoints you will need your applicationId and at least 1 Bandwidth phone number. More information can be found on https://dev.bandwidth.com/messaging/about.html

item.name: Voice Tutorials

request.description: Creates a new phone call
Updates a phone call to a new BXML endpoint
Ends an active phone call

item.description: This is the Bandwidth Voice tutorials. In order to use these endpoints you will need your applicationId and at least 1 Bandwidth phone number. If you want your phone call to be interactive, you will need a server to host BXML and include an endpoint to retrieve this BXML on your API requests (applicationUrl is the field). More information can be found on https://dev.bandwidth.com/voice/about.html

item.name: Numbers Tutorials

request.description:
This API call searches for available phone numbers based on one or more of the following criteria:

Area Code
NPA-NXX
NPA-NXX with Local Area Calling
NPA-NXX-X
NPA-NXX-X with Local Area Calling
RateCenter
RateCenter with Local Area Calling
State
City/State
Zip Code
LATA
Local Vanity
TollFree Vanity
TollFree WildCard Pattern

Order a set of numbers known to be available.
This often results if the numbers have been
found using a separate availableNumbers search
If the numbers have previously been reserved,
a reservation id must be included
GET all of the details associated with an identified order

Order a set of numbers known to be available.
This often results if the numbers have been
found using a separate availableNumbers search
If the numbers have previously been reserved,
a reservation id must be included
GET all of the details associated with an identified order

Creates a removeImportedTnOrders request to remove imported telephone numbers from the given site ID and sippeer ID as specified in the body. A successfully submitted order will have a status of "PROCESSING". A successfully completed order will have a status of "COMPLETE" if all of the telephone numbers were successfully removed and "PARTIAL" if some of the telephone numbers were removed. A failed order with will have a staus of "FAILED" and no telephone numbers would have been removed. The elements supplied in the payloads are described in the following table:

item.name: Create Remove Imported Tn Order  Copy

request.description: Creates a removeImportedTnOrders request to remove imported telephone numbers from the given site ID and sippeer ID as specified in the body. A successfully submitted order will have a status of "PROCESSING". A successfully completed order will have a status of "COMPLETE" if all of the telephone numbers were successfully removed and "PARTIAL" if some of the telephone numbers were removed. A failed order with will have a staus of "FAILED" and no telephone numbers would have been removed. The elements supplied in the payloads are described in the following table:

item.name: Import TNs for Hosted Messaging

request.description: Before creating the order, to reduce failed or error statuses, create a POST request to the /importTnChecker endpoint to check if the number can be brought in to your Bandwidth account. A non-errored response from the importTnChecker doesn't necessarily mean that the order will succeed, but is a good indicator of success.
After validating the numbers are able to be imported, create a POST request to create the order to import the phone numbers in to your Bandwidth account.
**Optional** At anytime, you're able to get the order status by creating a GET request to the order-id returned when creating the importTnOrder.

Optional, but recommended. To finally confirm that the phone number was successfully imported into your Bandwidth account, create a GET request to the inserviceNumbers to list the numbers in your account.

If everything was imported correctly, the recently imported number will appear in the returned payload.

item.description: This walks through how to programmatically import Phone Numbers to your account for use with Bandwidth's Messaging Products.

item.name: List SMS Features on a location
Create SMS Features on a location
List MMS Features on a location
Create MMS Features on a location
List Voice Origination Features on a location
Add & Update Voice Origination Features on a location
List Voice Termination Features on a location

item.description:
This is the collection of requests to enable your account for use with HTTP Voice and HTTP Messaging

At a high level this covers:

* Creating site (subaccount)
* Creating sippeer (location)
* Creating Voice application (callback URL management)
* Creating Messaging application (callback URL management)
* Assigning applications to sippeers (locations)
* Enabling the sippeers (locations) to support the HTTP Products
This is the Account Management tutorials

item.name: getCallRecordings
item.description: Returns a (potentially empty) list of metadata for the recordings that took place during the specified call

request.description: Returns a (potentially empty) list of metadata for the recordings that took place during the specified call

item.name: getConferenceRecordings
item.description: Returns a (potentially empty) list of metadata for the recordings that took place during the specified conference

request.description: Returns a (potentially empty) list of metadata for the recordings that took place during the specified conference

item.name: queryCallRecordings
item.description: Returns a list of metadata for the recordings associated with the specified account. The list can be filtered by the optional from, to, minStartTime, and maxStartTime arguments. The list is capped at 1000 entries and may be empty if no recordings match the specified criteria.

request.description: Returns a list of metadata for the recordings associated with the specified account. The list can be filtered by the optional from, to, minStartTime, and maxStartTime arguments. The list is capped at 1000 entries and may be empty if no recordings match the specified criteria.

Participants are idempotent, so relevant parameters must be set in this function if desired

item.name: getParticipantSubscriptions
item.description: Get a participant's subscriptions

request.description: Get a participant's subscriptions

item.name: updateParticipantSubscriptions
item.description:
Update a participant's subscriptions

This is a full update that will replace the participant's subscriptions. First call `getParticipantSubscriptions` if you need the current subscriptions. Call this function with no `Subscriptions` object to remove all subscriptions
